text: The first account I composed, Theophilus, about all that Jesus began to do and teach,
speaker: Narrator

text: until the day when He was taken up to heaven, after He had given orders by the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom He had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: To these He also presented Himself alive after His suffering, by many convincing proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days and speaking of things regarding the kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gathering them together, He commanded them not to leave Jerusalem, but to wait for what the Father had promised, “Which,” He said, “you heard of from Me;
speaker: Narrator

text: for John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So, when they had come together, they began asking Him, saying, “Lord, is it at this time that You are restoring the kingdom to Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to them, “It is not for you to know periods of time or appointed times which the Father has set by His own authority;
speaker: Narrator

text: but you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you; and you shall be My witnesses both in Jerusalem and in all Judea, and Samaria, and as far as the remotest part of the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And after He had said these things, He was lifted up while they were watching, and a cloud took Him up, out of their sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they were gazing intently into the sky while He was going, then behold, two men in white clothing stood beside them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they said, “Men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into the sky? This Jesus, who has been taken up from you into heaven, will come in the same way as you have watched Him go into heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s journey away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had entered the city, they went up to the upstairs room where they were staying, that is, Peter, John, James, and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were continually devoting themselves with one mind to prayer, along with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with His brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: At this time Peter stood up among the brothers and sisters (a group of about 120 people was there together), and said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Brothers, the Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit foretold by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became a guide to those who arrested Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he was counted among us and received his share in this ministry.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now this man acquired a field with the price of his wickedness, and falling headlong, he burst open in the middle and all his intestines gushed out.

text: And it became known to all the residents of Jerusalem; as a result that field was called Hakeldama in their own language, that is, Field of Blood.)

and,

speaker: Narrator

text: beginning with the baptism of John until the day that He was taken up from us—one of these must become a witness with us of His resurrection.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they put forward two men, Joseph called Barsabbas (who was also called Justus), and Matthias.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they prayed and said, “You, Lord, who know the hearts of all people, show which one of these two You have chosen
speaker: Narrator

text: to occupy this ministry and apostleship from which Judas turned aside to go to his own place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they drew lots for them, and the lot fell to Matthias; and he was added to the eleven apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the day of Pentecost had come, they were all together in one place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And suddenly a noise like a violent rushing wind came from heaven, and it filled the whole house where they were sitting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And tongues that looked like fire appeared to them, distributing themselves, and a tongue rested on each one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak with different tongues, as the Spirit was giving them the ability to speak out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were Jews residing in Jerusalem, devout men from every nation under heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when this sound occurred, the crowd came together and they were bewildered, because each one of them was hearing them speak in his own language.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were amazed and astonished, saying, “Why, are not all these who are speaking Galileans?
speaker: Narrator

text: And how is it that we each hear them in our own language to which we were born?
speaker: Narrator

text: Parthians, Medes, and Elamites, and residents of Mesopotamia, Judea, and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya around Cyrene, and visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,
speaker: Narrator

text: Cretans and Arabs—we hear them speaking in our own tongues of the mighty deeds of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they all continued in amazement and great perplexity, saying to one another, “What does this mean?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But others were jeering and saying, “They are full of sweet wine!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter, taking his stand with the other eleven, raised his voice and declared to them: “Men of Judea and all you who live in Jerusalem, know this, and pay attention to my words.
speaker: Narrator

text: For these people are not drunk, as you assume, since it is only the third hour of the day;
speaker: Narrator

text: but this is what has been spoken through the prophet Joel:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

And even on My male and female servants

speaker: Narrator

The sun will be turned into darkness

speaker: Narrator

text: “Men of Israel, listen to these words: Jesus the Nazarene, a Man attested to you by God with miracles and wonders and signs which God performed through Him in your midst, just as you yourselves know—
speaker: Narrator

text: this Man, delivered over by the predetermined plan and foreknowledge of God, you nailed to a cross by the hands of godless men and put Him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God raised Him from the dead, putting an end to the agony of death, since it was impossible for Him to be held in its power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For David says of Him,
‘I saw the Lord continually before me,
Because He is at my right hand, so that I will not be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore my heart was glad and my tongue was overjoyed;
Moreover my flesh also will live in hope;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You will not abandon my soul to Hades,
Nor will You allow Your Holy One to undergo decay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made known to me the ways of life;
You will make me full of gladness with Your presence.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Brothers, I may confidently say to you regarding the patriarch David that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So because he was a prophet and knew that God had sworn to him with an oath to seat one of his descendants on his throne,
speaker: Narrator

text: he looked ahead and spoke of the resurrection of the Christ, that He was neither abandoned to Hades, nor did His flesh suffer decay.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is this Jesus whom God raised up, a fact to which we are all witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, since He has been exalted at the right hand of God, and has received the promise of the Holy Spirit from the Father, He has poured out this which you both see and hear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it was not David who ascended into heaven, but he himself says:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at My right hand,
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore let all the house of Israel know for certain that God has made Him both Lord and Christ—this Jesus whom you crucified.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they heard this, they were pierced to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Brothers, what are we to do?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to them, “Repent, and each of you be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins; and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the promise is for you and your children and for all who are far away, as many as the Lord our God will call to Himself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And with many other words he solemnly testified and kept on urging them, saying, “Be saved from this perverse generation!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, those who had received his word were baptized; and that day there were added about three thousand souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were continually devoting themselves to the apostles’ teaching and to fellowship, to the breaking of bread and to prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone kept feeling a sense of awe; and many wonders and signs were taking place through the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the believers were together and had all things in common;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they would sell their property and possessions and share them with all, to the extent that anyone had need.
speaker: Narrator

text: Day by day continuing with one mind in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, they were taking their meals together with gladness and sincerity of heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord was adding to their number day by day those who were being saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Peter and John were going up to the temple at the ninth hour, the hour of prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a man who had been unable to walk from birth was being carried, whom they used to set down every day at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, in order for him to beg for charitable gifts from those entering the temple grounds.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw Peter and John about to go into the temple grounds, he began asking to receive a charitable gift.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter, along with John, looked at him intently and said, “Look at us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gave them his attention, expecting to receive something from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said, “I do not have silver and gold, but what I do have I give to you: In the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, walk!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And grasping him by the right hand, he raised him up; and immediately his feet and his ankles were strengthened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And leaping up, he stood and began to walk; and he entered the temple with them, walking and leaping and praising God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people saw him walking and praising God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they recognized him as being the very one who used to sit at the Beautiful Gate of the temple to beg for charitable gifts, and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was clinging to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them at the portico named Solomon’s, completely astonished.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Peter saw this, he replied to the people, “Men of Israel, why are you amazed at this, or why are you staring at us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk?
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified His Servant Jesus, the one whom you handed over and disowned in the presence of Pilate, when he had decided to release Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you disowned the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you,
speaker: Narrator

text: but put to death the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, a fact to which we are witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the basis of faith in His name, it is the name of Jesus which has strengthened this man whom you see and know; and the faith which comes through Him has given him this perfect health in the presence of you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And now, brothers, I know that you acted in ignorance, just as your rulers also did.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the things which God previously announced by the mouths of all the prophets, that His Christ would suffer, He has fulfilled in this way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore repent and return, so that your sins may be wiped away, in order that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: and that He may send Jesus, the Christ appointed for you,
speaker: Narrator

text: whom heaven must receive until the period of restoration of all things, about which God spoke by the mouths of His holy prophets from ancient times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, ‘The Lord God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your countrymen; to Him you shall listen regarding everything He says to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be that every soul that does not listen to that prophet shall be utterly destroyed from among the people.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And likewise, all the prophets who have spoken from Samuel and his successors onward, have also announced these days.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is you who are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant which God ordained with your fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘And in your seed all the families of the earth shall be blessed.’
speaker: Narrator

text: God raised up His Servant for you first, and sent Him to bless you by turning every one of you from your wicked ways.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were speaking to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple guard and the Sadducees came up to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: being greatly disturbed because they were teaching the people and proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laid hands on them and put them in prison until the next day, for it was already evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: But many of those who had heard the message believed; and the number of the men came to be about five thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day, their rulers and elders and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Annas the high priest was there, and Caiaphas, John, and Alexander, and all who were of high-priestly descent.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had placed them in the center, they began to inquire, “By what power, or in what name, have you done this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers and elders of the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: if we are on trial today for a benefit done to a sick man, as to how this man has been made well,
speaker: Narrator

text: let it be known to all of you and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead—by this name this man stands here before you in good health.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the stone which was rejected by you, the builders, but which became the chief cornerstone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there is salvation in no one else; for there is no other name under heaven that has been given among mankind by which we must be saved.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as they observed the confidence of Peter and John and understood that they were uneducated and untrained men, they were amazed, and began to recognize them as having been with Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And seeing the man who had been healed standing with them, they had nothing to say in reply.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they had ordered them to leave the Council, they began to confer with one another,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “What are we to do with these men? For the fact that a noteworthy miracle has taken place through them is apparent to all who live in Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But so that it will not spread any further among the people, let’s warn them not to speak any longer to any person in this name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had summoned them, they commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter and John answered and said to them, “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than to God, make your own judgment;
speaker: Narrator

text: for we cannot stop speaking about what we have seen and heard.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had threatened them further, they let them go (finding no basis on which to punish them) on account of the people, because they were all glorifying God for what had happened;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the man on whom this miracle of healing had been performed was more than forty years old.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had been released, they went to their own companions and reported everything that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they heard this, they raised their voices to God with one mind and said, “Lord, it is You who made the heaven and the earth and the sea, and everything that is in them,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who by the Holy Spirit, through the mouth of our father David Your servant, said,
‘Why were the nations insolent,
And the peoples plotting in vain?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The kings of the earth took their stand,
And the rulers were gathered together
Against the Lord and against His Christ.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For truly in this city there were gathered together against Your holy Servant Jesus, whom You anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, along with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: to do whatever Your hand and purpose predestined to occur.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, Lord, look at their threats, and grant it to Your bond-servants to speak Your word with all confidence,
speaker: Narrator

text: while You extend Your hand to heal, and signs and wonders take place through the name of Your holy Servant Jesus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had prayed, the place where they had gathered together was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak the word of God with boldness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the congregation of those who believed were of one heart and soul; and not one of them claimed that anything belonging to him was his own, but all things were common property to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with great power the apostles were giving testimony to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and abundant grace was upon them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there was not a needy person among them, for all who were owners of land or houses would sell them and bring the proceeds of the sales
speaker: Narrator

text: and lay them at the apostles’ feet, and they would be distributed to each to the extent that any had need.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Joseph, a Levite of Cyprian birth, who was also called Barnabas by the apostles (which translated means Son of Encouragement),
speaker: Narrator

text: owned a tract of land. So he sold it, and brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But a man named Ananias, with his wife Sapphira, sold a piece of property,
speaker: Narrator

text: and kept back some of the proceeds for himself, with his wife’s full knowledge, and bringing a portion of it, he laid it at the apostles’ feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and to keep back some of the proceeds of the land?
speaker: Narrator

text: While it remained unsold, did it not remain your own? And after it was sold, was it not under your control? Why is it that you have conceived this deed in your heart? You have not lied to men, but to God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he heard these words, Ananias collapsed and died; and great fear came over all who heard about it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young men got up and covered him up, and after carrying him out, they buried him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now an interval of about three hours elapsed, and his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter responded to her, “Tell me whether you sold the land for this price?” And she said, “Yes, for that price.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter said to her, “Why is it that you have agreed together to put the Spirit of the Lord to the test? Behold, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out as well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately she collapsed at his feet and died; and the young men came in and found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her beside her husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: And great fear came over the whole church, and over all who heard about these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were taking place among the people; and they were all together in Solomon’s portico.
speaker: Narrator

text: But none of the rest dared to associate with them; however, the people held them in high esteem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And increasingly believers in the Lord, large numbers of men and women, were being added to their number,
speaker: Narrator

text: to such an extent that they even carried the sick out into the streets and laid them on cots and pallets, so that when Peter came by at least his shadow might fall on any of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people from the cities in the vicinity of Jerusalem were coming together as well, bringing people who were sick or tormented with unclean spirits, and they were all being healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the high priest stood up, along with all his associates (that is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy.
speaker: Narrator

text: They laid hands on the apostles and put them in a public prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the gates of the prison, and leading them out, he said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go, stand and speak to the people in the temple area the whole message of this Life.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Upon hearing this, they entered into the temple area about daybreak and began to teach.
Now when the high priest and his associates came, they called the Council together, that is, all the Senate of the sons of Israel, and sent orders to the prison for them to be brought.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the officers who came did not find them in the prison; and they returned and reported,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “We found the prison locked quite securely and the guards standing at the doors; but when we opened them, we found no one inside.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests heard these words, they were greatly perplexed about them as to what would come of this.
speaker: Narrator

text: But someone came and reported to them, “The men whom you put in prison are standing in the temple area and teaching the people!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the captain went along with the officers and proceeded to bring them back without violence (for they were afraid of the people, that they might be stoned).
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had brought them, they had them stand before the Council. The high priest interrogated them,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “We gave you strict orders not to continue teaching in this name, and yet, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching and intend to bring this Man’s blood upon us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter and the apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you put to death by hanging Him on a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the One whom God exalted to His right hand as a Prince and a Savior, to grant repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we are witnesses of these things; and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they heard this, they became infuriated and nearly decided to execute them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the Law, respected by all the people, stood up in the Council and gave orders to put the men outside for a short time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Men of Israel, be careful as to what you are about to do with these men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, some time ago Theudas appeared, claiming to be somebody, and a group of about four hundred men joined him. But he was killed, and all who followed him were dispersed and came to nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this man, Judas of Galilee appeared in the days of the census and drew away some people after him; he also perished, and all those who followed him were scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so in the present case, I say to you, stay away from these men and leave them alone, for if the source of this plan or movement is men, it will be overthrown;
speaker: Narrator

text: but if the source is God, you will not be able to overthrow them; or else you may even be found fighting against God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They followed his advice; and after calling the apostles in, they flogged them and ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and then released them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went on their way from the presence of the Council, rejoicing that they had been considered worthy to suffer shame for His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every day, in the temple and from house to house, they did not stop teaching and preaching the good news of Jesus as the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at this time, as the disciples were increasing in number, a complaint developed on the part of the Hellenistic Jews against the native Hebrews, because their widows were being overlooked in the daily serving of food.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the twelve summoned the congregation of the disciples and said, “It is not desirable for us to neglect the word of God in order to serve tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, brothers and sisters, select from among you seven men of good reputation, full of the Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may put in charge of this task.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we will devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The announcement found approval with the whole congregation; and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, and Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas, a proselyte from Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought these men before the apostles; and after praying, they laid their hands on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of God kept spreading; and the number of the disciples continued to increase greatly in Jerusalem, and a great many of the priests were becoming obedient to the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Stephen, full of grace and power, was performing great wonders and signs among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some men from what was called the Synagogue of the Freedmen, including both Cyrenians and Alexandrians, and some from Cilicia and Asia, rose up and argued with Stephen.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were unable to cope with his wisdom and the Spirit by whom he was speaking.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they secretly induced men to say, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes, and they came up to him and dragged him away, and brought him before the Council.
speaker: Narrator

text: They put forward false witnesses who said, “This man does not stop speaking against this holy place and the Law;
speaker: Narrator

text: for we have heard him say that this Nazarene, Jesus, will destroy this place and change the customs which Moses handed down to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all who were sitting in the Council stared at him, and they saw his face, which was like the face of an angel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the high priest said, “Are these things so?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Stephen said, “Listen to me, brothers and fathers! The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,
speaker: Narrator

text: and He said to him, ‘Go from your country and your relatives, and come to the land which I will show you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he left the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Haran. And from there, after his father died, God had him move to this country in which you are now living.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He gave him no inheritance in it, not even a foot of ground, and yet, He promised that He would give it to him as a possession, and to his descendants after him, even though he had no child.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God spoke to this effect, that his descendants would be strangers in a land that was not theirs, and they would enslave and mistreat them for four hundred years.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘And whatever nation to which they are enslaved I Myself will judge,’ said God, ‘and after that they will come out and serve Me in this place.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And He gave him the covenant of circumcision; and so Abraham fathered Isaac, and circumcised him on the eighth day; and Isaac fathered Jacob, and Jacob, the twelve patriarchs.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The patriarchs became jealous of Joseph and sold him into Egypt. Yet God was with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and rescued him from all his afflictions, and granted him favor and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and he made him governor over Egypt and his entire household.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now a famine came over all Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction with it, and our fathers could find no food.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our fathers there the first time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the second visit, Joseph made himself known to his brothers, and Joseph’s family was revealed to Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph sent word and invited his father Jacob and all his relatives to come to him, seventy-five people in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob went down to Egypt, and he and our fathers died there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were brought back from there to Shechem and laid in the tomb which Abraham had purchased for a sum of money from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But as the time of the promise which God had assured to Abraham was approaching, the people increased and multiplied in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: until another king arose over Egypt who did not know Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was he who shrewdly took advantage of our nation and mistreated our fathers in order that they would abandon their infants in the Nile, so that they would not survive.
speaker: Narrator

text: At this time Moses was born; and he was beautiful to God. He was nurtured for three months in his father’s home.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after he had been put outside, Pharaoh’s daughter took him away and nurtured him as her own son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and he was proficient in speaking and action.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he was approaching the age of forty, it entered his mind to visit his countrymen, the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he saw one of them being treated unjustly, he defended and took vengeance for the oppressed man by fatally striking the Egyptian.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he thought that his brothers understood that God was granting them deliverance through him; but they did not understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the following day he appeared to them as they were fighting each other, and he tried to reconcile them to peace, by saying, ‘Men, you are brothers, why are you injuring each other?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the one who was injuring his neighbor pushed him away, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and judge over us?
speaker: Narrator

text: You do not intend to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday, do you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: At this remark, Moses fled and became a stranger in the land of Midian, where he fathered two sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: “After forty years had passed, an angel appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in the flame of a burning thorn bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses saw it, he was astonished at the sight; and as he approached to look more closely, the voice of the Lord came:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob.’ Moses shook with fear and did not dare to look closely.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to him, ‘Remove your sandals from your feet, for the place on which you are standing is holy ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have certainly seen the oppression of My people who are in Egypt, and have heard their groaning, and I have come down to rescue them; and now come, I will send you to Egypt.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “This Moses whom they disowned, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge?’ is the one whom God sent to be both a ruler and a deliverer with the help of the angel who appeared to him in the thorn bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: This man led them out, performing wonders and signs in the land of Egypt and in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the Moses who said to the sons of Israel, ‘God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your countrymen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the one who was in the assembly in the wilderness together with the angel who spoke to him at length on Mount Sinai, and who was with our fathers; and he received living words to pass on to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers were unwilling to be obedient to him; on the contrary they rejected him and turned back to Egypt in their hearts,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying to Aaron, ‘Make us a god who will go before us; for this Moses who led us out of the land of Egypt—we do not know what happened to him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time they made a calf and brought a sacrifice to the idol, and were rejoicing in the works of their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God turned away and gave them over to serve the heavenly lights; as it is written in the book of the prophets: ‘You did not offer Me victims and sacrifices for forty years in the wilderness, did you, house of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: You also took along the tabernacle of Moloch and the star of your god Rompha, the images which you made to worship. I also will deport you beyond Babylon.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our fathers had the tabernacle of testimony in the wilderness, just as He who spoke to Moses directed him to make it according to the pattern which he had seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers in turn received it, and they also brought it in with Joshua upon dispossessing the nations that God drove out from our fathers, until the time of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David found favor in God’s sight, and asked that he might find a dwelling place for the house of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it was Solomon who built a house for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, the Most High does not dwell in houses made by human hands; as the prophet says:
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Heaven is My throne,
And the earth is the footstool of My feet;
What kind of house will you build for Me?’ says the Lord,
‘Or what place is there for My rest?
speaker: Narrator

text: Was it not My hand that made all these things?’
speaker: Narrator

text: “You men who are stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears are always resisting the Holy Spirit; you are doing just as your fathers did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which one of the prophets did your fathers not persecute? They killed those who had previously announced the coming of the Righteous One, and you have now become betrayers and murderers of Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: you who received the Law as ordained by angels, and yet did not keep it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they heard this, they were infuriated, and they began gnashing their teeth at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked intently into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said, “Behold, I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they shouted with loud voices, and covered their ears and rushed at him with one mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had driven him out of the city, they began stoning him; and the witnesses laid aside their cloaks at the feet of a young man named Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went on stoning Stephen as he called on the Lord and said, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he fell on his knees and cried out with a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them!” Having said this, he fell asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now Saul approved of putting Stephen to death.
And on that day a great persecution began against the church in Jerusalem, and they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except for the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some devout men buried Stephen, and mourned loudly for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul began ravaging the church, entering house after house; and he would drag away men and women and put them in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, those who had been scattered went through places preaching the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and began proclaiming the Christ to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowds were paying attention with one mind to what was being said by Philip, as they heard and saw the signs which he was performing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the case of many who had unclean spirits, they were coming out of them shouting with a loud voice; and many who had been paralyzed or limped on crutches were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So there was much rejoicing in that city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a man named Simon had previously been practicing magic in the city and astonishing the people of Samaria, claiming to be someone great;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the people, from small to great, were paying attention to him, saying, “This man is the Power of God that is called Great.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were paying attention to him because for a long time he had astounded them with his magic arts.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they believed Philip as he was preaching the good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, both men and women were being baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now even Simon himself believed; and after being baptized, he continued on with Philip, and as he observed signs and great miracles taking place, he was repeatedly amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent them Peter and John,
speaker: Narrator

text: who came down and prayed for them that they would receive the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For He had not yet fallen upon any of them; they had simply been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they began laying their hands on them, and they were receiving the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Simon saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Give this authority to me as well, so that everyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said to him, “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could acquire the gift of God with money!
speaker: Narrator

text: You have no part or share in this matter, for your heart is not right before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, repent of this wickedness of yours, and pray to the Lord that, if possible, the intention of your heart will be forgiven you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bondage of unrighteousness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Simon answered and said, “Pray to the Lord for me yourselves, so that nothing of what you have said may come upon me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So, when they had solemnly testified and spoken the word of the Lord, they started back to Jerusalem, and were preaching the gospel to many villages of the Samaritans.
speaker: Narrator

text: But an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying, “Get ready and go south to the road that descends from Jerusalem to Gaza.” (This is a desert road.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So he got ready and went; and there was an Ethiopian eunuch, a court official of Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was in charge of all her treasure; and he had come to Jerusalem to worship,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he was returning and sitting in his chariot, and was reading Isaiah the prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Spirit said to Philip, “Go up and join this chariot.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip ran up and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet, and said, “Do you understand what you are reading?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Well, how could I, unless someone guides me?” And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now the passage of Scripture which he was reading was this:
“He was led like a sheep to slaughter;
And like a lamb that is silent before its shearer,
So He does not open His mouth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: The eunuch answered Philip and said, “Please tell me, of whom does the prophet say this? Of himself, or of someone else?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this Scripture he preached Jesus to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they went along the road they came to some water; and the eunuch said, “Look! Water! What prevents me from being baptized?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he ordered that the chariot stop; and they both went down into the water, Philip as well as the eunuch, and he baptized him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away; and the eunuch no longer saw him, but went on his way rejoicing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Philip found himself at Azotus, and as he passed through he kept preaching the gospel to all the cities, until he came to Caesarea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Saul, still breathing threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest,
speaker: Narrator

text: and asked for letters from him to the synagogues in Damascus, so that if he found any belonging to the Way, whether men or women, he might bring them in shackles to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as he was traveling, it happened that he was approaching Damascus, and suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Who are You, Lord?” And He said, “I am Jesus whom you are persecuting,
speaker: Narrator

text: but get up and enter the city, and it will be told to you what you must do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The men who traveled with him stood speechless, hearing the voice but seeing no one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul got up from the ground, and though his eyes were open, he could see nothing; and leading him by the hand, they brought him into Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for three days he was without sight, and neither ate nor drank.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a disciple in Damascus named Ananias; and the Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias.” And he said, “Here I am, Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to him, “Get up and go to the street called Straight, and inquire at the house of Judas for a man from Tarsus named Saul, for he is praying,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he has seen in a vision a man named Ananias come in and lay his hands on him, so that he might regain his sight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard from many people about this man, how much harm he did to Your saints in Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: and here he has authority from the chief priests to arrest all who call on Your name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to him, “Go, for he is a chosen instrument of Mine, to bear My name before the Gentiles and kings and the sons of Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I will show him how much he must suffer in behalf of My name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Ananias departed and entered the house, and after laying his hands on him said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road by which you were coming, has sent me so that you may regain your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately something like fish scales fell from his eyes, and he regained his sight, and he got up and was baptized;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and he took food and was strengthened.
Now for several days he was with the disciples who were in Damascus,
speaker: Narrator

text: and immediately he began to proclaim Jesus in the synagogues, saying, “He is the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: All those hearing him continued to be amazed, and were saying, “Is this not the one who in Jerusalem destroyed those who called on this name, and had come here for the purpose of bringing them bound before the chief priests?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul kept increasing in strength and confounding Jews who lived in Damascus by proving that this Jesus is the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: When many days had elapsed, the Jews plotted together to do away with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: but their plot became known to Saul. They were also closely watching the gates day and night so that they might put him to death;
speaker: Narrator

text: but his disciples took him at night and let him down through an opening in the wall, lowering him in a large basket.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came to Jerusalem, he tried repeatedly to associate with the disciples; and yet they were all afraid of him, as they did not believe that he was a disciple.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Barnabas took hold of him and brought him to the apostles and described to them how he had seen the Lord on the road, and that He had talked to him, and how he had spoken out boldly in the name of Jesus at Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was with them, moving about freely in Jerusalem, speaking out boldly in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was talking and arguing with the Hellenistic Jews; but they were attempting to put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the brothers learned of it, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the church throughout Judea, Galilee, and Samaria enjoyed peace, as it was being built up; and as it continued in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, it kept increasing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as Peter was traveling through all those regions, he also came down to the saints who lived at Lydda.
speaker: Narrator

text: There he found a man named Aeneas who had been bedridden for eight years, because he was paralyzed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you; get up and make your own bed.” Immediately he got up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all who lived at Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha (which when translated means Dorcas); this woman was excelling in acts of kindness and charity which she did habitually.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it happened at that time that she became sick and died; and when they had washed her body, they laid it in an upstairs room.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, having heard that Peter was there, sent two men to him, urging him, “Do not delay in coming to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter got ready and went with them. When he arrived, they brought him into the room upstairs; and all the widows stood beside him, weeping and showing all the tunics and garments that Dorcas used to make while she was with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter sent them all out and knelt down and prayed, and turning to the body, he said, “Tabitha, arise.” And she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gave her his hand and raised her up; and calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: It became known all over Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter stayed in Joppa many days with a tanner named Simon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a man in Caesarea named Cornelius, a centurion of what was called the Italian cohort,
speaker: Narrator

text: a devout man and one who feared God with all his household, and made many charitable contributions to the Jewish people and prayed to God continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: About the ninth hour of the day he clearly saw in a vision an angel of God who had just come in and said to him, “Cornelius!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked at him intently and became terrified, and said, “What is it, lord?” And he said to him, “Your prayers and charitable gifts have ascended as a memorial offering before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now dispatch some men to Joppa and send for a man named Simon, who is also called Peter;
speaker: Narrator

text: he is staying with a tanner named Simon, whose house is by the sea.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the angel who spoke to him left, he summoned two of his servants and a devout soldier from his personal attendants,
speaker: Narrator

text: and after he had explained everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day, as they were on their way and approaching the city, Peter went up on the housetop about the sixth hour to pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he became hungry and wanted to eat; but while they were making preparations, he fell into a trance;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he saw the sky opened up, and an object like a great sheet coming down, lowered by four corners to the ground,
speaker: Narrator

text: and on it were all kinds of four-footed animals and crawling creatures of the earth and birds of the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice came to him, “Get up, Peter, kill and eat!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said, “By no means, Lord, for I have never eaten anything unholy and unclean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again a voice came to him a second time, “What God has cleansed, no longer consider unholy.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened three times, and immediately the object was taken up into the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while Peter was greatly perplexed in mind as to what the vision which he had seen might mean, behold, the men who had been sent by Cornelius had asked directions to Simon’s house, and they appeared at the gate;
speaker: Narrator

text: and calling out, they were asking whether Simon, who was also called Peter, was staying there.
speaker: Narrator

text: While Peter was reflecting on the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, three men are looking for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But get up, go downstairs and accompany them without misgivings, for I have sent them Myself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter went down to the men and said, “Behold, I am the one you are looking for; what is the reason for which you have come?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Cornelius, a centurion, a righteous and God-fearing man well spoken of by the entire nation of the Jews, was divinely directed by a holy angel to send for you to come to his house and hear a message from you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he invited them in and gave them lodging.
Now on the next day he got ready and went away with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the following day he entered Caesarea. Now Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter entered, Cornelius met him, and fell at his feet and worshiped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter helped him up, saying, “Stand up; I, too, am just a man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he talked with him, he entered and found many people assembled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “You yourselves know that it is forbidden for a Jewish man to associate with or visit a foreigner; and yet God has shown me that I am not to call any person unholy or unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: That is why I came without even raising any objection when I was sent for. So I ask, for what reason did you send for me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Cornelius said, “Four days ago to this hour, I was praying in my house during the ninth hour; and behold, a man stood before me in shining clothing,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard and your charitable gifts have been remembered before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore send some men to Joppa and invite Simon, who is also called Peter, to come to you; he is staying at the house of Simon the tanner, by the sea.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So I sent men to you immediately, and you have been kind enough to come. Now then, we are all here present before God to hear everything that you have been commanded by the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Opening his mouth, Peter said:
“I most certainly understand now that God is not one to show partiality,
speaker: Narrator

text: but in every nation the one who fears Him and does what is right is acceptable to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word which He sent to the sons of Israel, preaching peace through Jesus Christ (He is Lord of all)—
speaker: Narrator

text: you yourselves know the thing that happened throughout Judea, starting from Galilee, after the baptism which John proclaimed.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know of Jesus of Nazareth, how God anointed Him with the Holy Spirit and with power, and how He went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are witnesses of all the things that He did both in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem. They also put Him to death by hanging Him on a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: God raised Him up on the third day and granted that He be revealed,
speaker: Narrator

text: not to all the people, but to witnesses who had been chosen beforehand by God, that is, to us who ate and drank with Him after He arose from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He ordered us to preach to the people, and to testify solemnly that this is the One who has been appointed by God as Judge of the living and the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the prophets testify of Him, that through His name everyone who believes in Him receives forgiveness of sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell upon all those who were listening to the message.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Jewish believers who came with Peter were amazed, because the gift of the Holy Spirit had also been poured out on the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they were hearing them speaking with tongues and exalting God. Then Peter responded,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Surely no one can refuse the water for these to be baptized, who have received the Holy Spirit just as we did, can he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he ordered them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay on for a few days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the apostles and the brothers and sisters who were throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Peter came up to Jerusalem, the Jewish believers took issue with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “You went to uncircumcised men and ate with them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter began and explained at length to them in an orderly sequence, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying; and in a trance I saw a vision, an object coming down like a great sheet lowered by four corners from the sky; and it came to where I was,
speaker: Narrator

text: and I stared at it and was thinking about it, and I saw the four-footed animals of the earth, the wild animals, the crawling creatures, and the birds of the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Get up, Peter; kill and eat.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said, ‘By no means, Lord, for nothing unholy or unclean has ever entered my mouth.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But a voice from heaven answered a second time, ‘What God has cleansed, no longer consider unholy.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened three times, and everything was drawn back up into the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, at that moment three men who had been sent to me from Caesarea came up to the house where we were staying.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit told me to go with them without misgivings. These six brothers also went with me, and we entered the man’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he reported to us how he had seen the angel standing in his house, and saying, ‘Send some men to Joppa and have Simon, who is also called Peter, brought here;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he will speak words to you by which you will be saved, you and all your household.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell upon them just as He did upon us at the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I remembered the word of the Lord, how He used to say, ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, if God gave them the same gift as He also gave to us after believing in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I that I could stand in God’s way?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard this, they quieted down and glorified God, saying, “Well then, God has also granted to the Gentiles the repentance that leads to life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then those who were scattered because of the persecution that occurred in connection with Stephen made their way to Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except to Jews alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who came to Antioch and began speaking to the Greeks as well, preaching the good news of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a large number who believed turned to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The news about them reached the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas off to Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then when he arrived and witnessed the grace of God, he rejoiced and began to encourage them all with resolute heart to remain true to the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: for he was a good man, and full of the Holy Spirit and faith. And considerable numbers were added to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he left for Tarsus to look for Saul;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. And for an entire year they met with the church and taught considerable numbers of people; and the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at this time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of them, named Agabus, stood up and indicated by the Spirit that there would definitely be a severe famine all over the world. And this took place in the reign of Claudius.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to the extent that any of the disciples had means, each of them determined to send a contribution for the relief of the brothers and sisters living in Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did this, sending it with Barnabas and Saul to the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now about that time Herod the king laid hands on some who belonged to the church, to do them harm.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he had James the brother of John executed with a sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter as well. (Now these were the days of Unleavened Bread.)
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had arrested him, he put him in prison, turning him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending only after the Passover to bring him before the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter was kept in the prison, but prayer for him was being made to God intensely by the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the very night when Herod was about to bring him forward, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and guards in front of the door were watching over the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, an angel of the Lord suddenly stood near Peter, and a light shone in the cell; and he struck Peter’s side and woke him, saying, “Get up quickly.” And his chains fell off his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel said to him, “Put on your belt and strap on your sandals.” And he did so. And he said to him, “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went out and continued to follow, and yet he did not know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they had passed the first and second guard, they came to the iron gate that leads into the city, which opened for them by itself; and they went out and went along one street, and immediately the angel departed from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter came to himself, he said, “Now I know for sure that the Lord has sent forth His angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod and from all that the Jewish people were expecting.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John, who was also called Mark, where many were gathered together and were praying.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he knocked at the door of the gate, a slave woman named Rhoda came to answer.
speaker: Narrator

text: When she recognized Peter’s voice, because of her joy she did not open the gate, but ran in and announced that Peter was standing in front of the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to her, “You are out of your mind!” But she kept insisting that it was so. They said, “It is his angel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter continued knocking; and when they had opened the door, they saw him and were amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But motioning to them with his hand to be silent, he described to them how the Lord had led him out of the prison. And he said, “Report these things to James and the brothers.” Then he left and went to another place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when day came, there was no small disturbance among the soldiers as to what could have become of Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Herod had searched for him and had not found him, he examined the guards and ordered that they be led away to execution. Then he went down from Judea to Caesarea and was spending time there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon; and with one mind they came to him, and having won over Blastus the king’s chamberlain, they were asking for peace, because their country was supported with grain from the king’s country.
speaker: Narrator

text: On an appointed day, after putting on his royal apparel, Herod took his seat on the rostrum and began delivering an address to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people repeatedly cried out, “The voice of a god and not of a man!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately an angel of the Lord struck him because he did not give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of the Lord continued to grow and to be multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Barnabas and Saul returned when they had fulfilled their mission to Jerusalem, taking along with them John, who was also called Mark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were prophets and teachers at Antioch, in the church that was there: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were serving the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set Barnabas and Saul apart for Me for the work to which I have called them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then, when they had fasted, prayed, and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia and from there they sailed to Cyprus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they reached Salamis, they began to proclaim the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews; and they also had John as their helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had gone through the whole island as far as Paphos, they found a magician, a Jewish false prophet whose name was Bar-Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a man of intelligence. This man summoned Barnabas and Saul and sought to hear the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Elymas the magician (for so his name is translated) was opposing them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul, who was also known as Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, stared at him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “You who are full of all deceit and fraud, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness, will you not stop making crooked the straight ways of the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon you, and you will be blind and not see the sun for a time.” And immediately a mist and a darkness fell upon him, and he went about seeking those who would lead him by the hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the proconsul believed when he saw what had happened, being amazed at the teaching of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Paul and his companions put out to sea from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia; but John left them and returned to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: But going on from Perga, they arrived at Pisidian Antioch, and on the Sabbath day they went into the synagogue and sat down.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the reading of the Law and the Prophets, the synagogue officials sent word to them, saying, “Brothers, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, say it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Paul stood up, and motioning with his hand said,
“Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen:
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers and made the people great during their stay in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm He led them out from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a period of about forty years He put up with them in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, He distributed their land as an inheritance—all of which took about 450 years.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things He gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they asked for a king, and God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: After He had removed him, He raised up David to be their king, concerning whom He also testified and said, ‘I have found David, the son of Jesse, a man after My heart, who will do all My will.’
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of this man, according to promise, God has brought to Israel a Savior, Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: after John had proclaimed, before His coming, a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And while John was completing his course, he kept saying, ‘What do you suppose that I am? I am not He. But behold, One is coming after me, the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to untie.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Brothers, sons of Abraham’s family, and those among you who fear God, to us the message of this salvation has been sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who live in Jerusalem, and their rulers, recognizing neither Him nor the declarations of the prophets which are read every Sabbath, fulfilled these by condemning Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And though they found no grounds for putting Him to death, they asked Pilate that He be executed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had carried out everything that was written concerning Him, they took Him down from the cross and laid Him in a tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God raised Him from the dead;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for many days He appeared to those who came up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem, the very ones who are now His witnesses to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we preach to you the good news of the promise made to the fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: that God has fulfilled this promise to those of us who are the descendants by raising Jesus, as it is also written in the second Psalm: ‘You are My Son; today I have fathered You.’
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the fact that He raised Him from the dead, never again to return to decay, He has spoken in this way: ‘I will give you the holy and faithful mercies of David.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, He also says in another Psalm: ‘You will not allow Your Holy One to undergo decay.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For David, after he had served God’s purpose in his own generation, fell asleep, and was buried among his fathers and underwent decay;
speaker: Narrator

text: but He whom God raised did not undergo decay.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore let it be known to you, brothers, that through Him forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and through Him everyone who believes is freed from all things, from which you could not be freed through the Law of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, see that the thing spoken of in the Prophets does not come upon you:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: As Paul and Barnabas were going out, the people repeatedly begged to have these things spoken to them the next Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the meeting of the synagogue had broken up, many of the Jews and the God-fearing proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who were speaking to them and urging them to continue in the grace of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next Sabbath nearly all the city assembled to hear the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy and began contradicting the things spoken by Paul, and were blaspheming.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly and said, “It was necessary that the word of God be spoken to you first. Since you repudiate it and consider yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we are turning to the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For so the Lord has commanded us,
‘I have appointed You as a light to the Gentiles,
That You may bring salvation to the end of the earth.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Gentiles heard this, they began rejoicing and glorifying the word of the Lord; and all who had been appointed to eternal life believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord was being spread through the whole region.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Jews incited the devout women of prominence and the leading men of the city, and instigated a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them out of their region.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they shook off the dust from their feet in protest against them and went to Iconium.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the disciples were continually filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Iconium they entered the synagogue of the Jews together, and spoke in such a way that a large number of people believed, both of Jews and of Greeks.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the minds of the Gentiles and embittered them against the brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they spent a long time there speaking boldly with reliance upon the Lord, who was testifying to the word of His grace, granting that signs and wonders be performed by their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the people of the city were divided; and some sided with the Jews, while others, with the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when an attempt was made by both the Gentiles and the Jews with their rulers, to treat them abusively and to stone them,
speaker: Narrator

text: they became aware of it and fled to the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe, and the surrounding region;
speaker: Narrator

text: and there they continued to preach the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Lystra a man was sitting whose feet were incapacitated. He had been disabled from his mother’s womb, and had never walked.
speaker: Narrator

text: This man was listening to Paul as he spoke. Paul looked at him intently and saw that he had faith to be made well,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said with a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet!” And the man leaped up and began to walk.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowds saw what Paul had done, they raised their voice, saying in the Lycaonian language, “The gods have become like men and have come down to us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began calling Barnabas, Zeus, and Paul, Hermes, since he was the chief speaker.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the priest of Zeus, whose temple was just outside the city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, and wanted to offer sacrifice with the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard about it, they tore their robes and rushed out into the crowd, crying out
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “Men, why are you doing these things? We are also men, of the same nature as you, preaching the gospel to you, to turn from these useless things to a living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea, and everything that is in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In past generations He permitted all the nations to go their own ways;
speaker: Narrator

text: yet He did not leave Himself without witness, in that He did good and gave you rains from heaven and fruitful seasons, satisfying your hearts with food and gladness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And even by saying these things, only with difficulty did they restrain the crowds from offering sacrifices to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jews came from Antioch and Iconium, and having won over the crowds, they stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city, thinking that he was dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: But while the disciples stood around him, he got up and entered the city. The next day he left with Barnabas for Derbe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after they had preached the gospel to that city and had made a good number of disciples, they returned to Lystra, to Iconium, and to Antioch,
speaker: Narrator

text: strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to continue in the faith, and saying, “It is through many tribulations that we must enter the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had appointed elders for them in every church, having prayed with fasting, they entrusted them to the Lord in whom they had believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: They passed through Pisidia and came into Pamphylia.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they sailed to Antioch, where they had been entrusted to the grace of God for the work that they had accomplished.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had arrived and gathered the church together, they began to report all the things that God had done with them and how He had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they spent a long time with the disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some men came down from Judea and began teaching the brothers, “Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses, you cannot be saved.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And after Paul and Barnabas had a heated argument and debate with them, the brothers determined that Paul and Barnabas and some others of them should go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders concerning this issue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, after being sent on their way by the church, they were passing through both Phoenicia and Samaria, describing in detail the conversion of the Gentiles, and they were bringing great joy to all the brothers and sisters.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they arrived in Jerusalem, they were received by the church, the apostles, and the elders, and they reported all that God had done with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some of the sect of the Pharisees who had believed stood up, saying, “It is necessary to circumcise them and to direct them to keep the Law of Moses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The apostles and the elders came together to look into this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: After there had been much debate, Peter stood up and said to them, “Brothers, you know that in the early days God made a choice among you, that by my mouth the Gentiles would hear the word of the gospel and believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God, who knows the heart, testified to them giving them the Holy Spirit, just as He also did to us;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He made no distinction between us and them, cleansing their hearts by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since this is the case, why are you putting God to the test by placing upon the neck of the disciples a yoke which neither our forefathers nor we have been able to bear?
speaker: Narrator

text: But we believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus, in the same way as they also are.”
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people kept silent, and they were listening to Barnabas and Paul as they were relating all the signs and wonders that God had done through them among the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they stopped speaking, James responded, saying, “Brothers, listen to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simeon has described how God first concerned Himself about taking a people for His name from among the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of the Prophets agree with this, just as it is written:
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘After these things I will return,
And I will rebuild the fallen tabernacle of David,
And I will rebuild its ruins,
And I will restore it,
speaker: Narrator

text:
So that the rest of mankind may seek the Lord,
